turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Chronic lymphocytic leukemia.
turn.1: What are the risk factors for Chronic lymphocytic leukemia?
turn.2: Exposure to Agent Orange increases the risk of CLL, and exposure to hepatitis C virus may increase the risk.
turn.3: Are there any other known risk factors?
turn.4: There is no clear association between ionizing radiation exposure and the risk of developing CLL.
turn.5: Are there any other known risk factors?
turn.6: Blood transfusions have been ruled out as a risk factor.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Approximately half of CLL patinets harbor a loss of a genomic region at chromosome 13 that contains 2 miRNA genes, and this has been directly linked with the onset of the disease.
turn.9: Are there any other known risk factors?
turn.10: The most aggressive subtype of the disease is characterized by loss of p53 (deletion 17p or p53 mutation).
turn.11: What are the early signs of the disease?
turn.12: CLL is usually first suspected by a diagnosis of lymphocytosis, an increase in a type of white blood cell, on a complete blood count test.
